fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-6680].
  {panel}

This functionality is missing as of Version: 2.2.5 Build:#520

The easiest way to describe this missing functionality is with an example.

In a confluence wiki if one searches for a hostname for example "appserver28nyc" and some pages on the wiki contain the string "appserver28nyc" in a context like "if the server your using is appserver28nyc then blah blah" whereas other pages on the wiki contain the string "appserver28nyc" in a context of like "make sure not to reboot appserver28nyc.dbpool.servers.domain.com since it will" only the former pages will be returned.

This happens because confluence (like other search engines like google) only searches for whole words, not substrings of words. Most search engines (like google) consider the period character "." to define a break in search tokens so that from an indexing perspective "appserver28nyc.dbpool.servers.domain.com" would be considered as 5 seperate tokens appserver28nyc, dbpool, servers, domain, and com. Confluence does not.

An easy way to see this work in other search engines is by searching for "192.168" on any major search engine.

If you create a page in confluence with the string "192.168.1.1" and then search for "192.168" you'll get 0 results.

This would be very useful and would move confluence towards conforming to standard practices in search.
fields.summary: Break search tokens on period "." as well as space " "

fields.description: Create a space with the "Anonymous" group having the "view" permission.  Disable ALL group permissions.  When browsing anonymously, the space is accessible from the Dashboard.  Once you have logged in, the space is no longer visible.  Users which have logged in are not inheriting the permissions given to the Anonymous group.  Also, when the Anonymous view permission is set globally, all spaces which are created should have the Anonymous view permissions by default.  If a space is meant to be hidden in this instance, a space admin will have to set these permissions specifically.  Carrying over the Anonymous view permission as  a default if it is set globally will allow users to browse ALL content in Confluence without logging in, unless the space is PURPOSELY changed to remove the Anonymous view permission.
fields.summary: Registered confluence users do not inherit Anonymous Permissions

fields.description:
From using GMail I've developed a motor memory of "tab-enter" after editing to send.  Writing a page comment in Wiki Markup, the Post button is right beneath the text box and I expect that tab will take me to Post and enter will hit the button.

But instead, tabbing from that box focuses on the Dashboard link and hitting enter navigates there, erasing the comment I painstakingly composed.  Which sucks.

Seems like an easy improvement to make without any adverse side-effects.
fields.summary: Tab from comment writing should go to Post button

fields.description:
When I go to the Global Permissions -> Edit Permissions button for Groups using IE I get a message saying object expected. It happens whenever the page gets focus and I have the first text box as the active field. The popup will only appear when script debugging is enabled. 

My debugger points to this line below. 

<input type="textfield" id='groupsToAdd' name='groupsToAdd' value="" size="40" onFocus="javascript:checkEditGroup();return true;" /> 

checkEditGroup doesn't seem to be defined as a function.
fields.summary: JavaScript Popup Saying "Object Expected" on the Edit Global Permissions Page

fields.description: We would like to have 3D visualisation/navigation of the wiki's content using tools such as Touchgraph, or others. For example, MEatball-type wikis generate an asci flat file of the whole database pagenames, links and addresses. Then, Touchgraph WikiBrowser renders a 3D navigation interface of the file  (see: http://www.usemod.com/cgi-bin/mb.pl?TouchGraphWikiBrowser ). Could something similar be allowed by Confluence? 3D mapping/visualization of Confluence's content is becoming more and more important as it grows. (or let me know if something similar is already possible making use of current RSS feeds or in other ways)
fields.summary: Meatball-type LinkDatabase file needed to enable 3D visualization of the wiki

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-6673].
  {panel}

The Sun JDK zip API fails when trying to open zip files larger than 2 GB. It has been suggested that we should investigate alternative APIs.

14:31:58,158 ERROR [ExportUtils] Error determining export type from export zip: /data/confluence/restore/david.zip
java.util.zip.ZipException: invalid END header (bad central directory size)
        at java.util.zip.ZipFile.open(Native Method)
        at java.util.zip.ZipFile.<init>(ZipFile.java:203)
        at java.util.zip.ZipFile.<init>(ZipFile.java:234) 

In the meantime, the suggested workaround for this issue is to disable automatic backups and backup the Confluence database and home directory using an external scheduling system.
fields.summary: Use different ZIP API to allow restoring backups larger than 2 GB

fields.description:
Autosaving is great until you lose session or connection or whatever.  At that point, you are happily typiing away in a severed client ASSUMING your work is being autosaved every 30s but its only when you go to hit 'save' that you see the login prompt, and after logging in you get returned to a 'vew' screen.

It'd be REALLY useful to have an autosave error, big red font, appear in your browser when the autosave could not complete for some reason.  This would prompt you to rectify the scenario by re-logging in, resuming draft, etc etc as intended.
fields.summary: autosave is not enough without session error notifies

fields.description: Can the options for the type parameter in the recently-updated macro be expanded so the page changes are split into minor (set by the checkbox on the edit page) and major.
fields.summary: Allow filtering of minor page changes in recently-updated macro

fields.description:
When I click on the link "Contact Administrators" at the bottom of the page, I get a page with the following contents: 

Site Administrators 

The following users have administrative access on this Confluence installation and may be able to help you if you are having any problems. 
$getText("no.admins") 

It seems that a template text is missing. We didn't make any custom changes to the layouts.
fields.summary: Contact administrators page broken $getText("no.admins") instead of message appears

fields.description:
Currently we have two installations of confluence
one on linux server - base encoding koi-8
and one on windows - base encoding win1251

and have the following problem :

We have installed Dynamic Table Plugin at confluences and when we try to use it with Cyrillic alphabet we have a problem
will try to describe problem

1) I enter Cyrillic letters to Dynamic Table form

2) plugin generate URL using this code

for (var i = 0; i < cellCount; i++) {
uri = uri + "&cells=" + escape(formElem.elements["cells[" + i + "]"].value);
// [" + i + "]
}

and as you see 'escape' function translates cyrillic letters to unicode
3) plugin using Ajax send this info to confluence

var req = new Ajax.Request(uri, opts);

4) I dont know what confluence do with this data ;(

5) At Server's side (JAVA code of plugin) after confluence done it's work with params debugger show me only noncyrillic letters at array cells[] (at TableAction.java (if this important for you))


if at 2) change 'escape' function to encodeURIComponent letters will be avaylible at server side but will be shown not correctly (like bad transformated resuln of 'escape' function) for example "№/u4578" instead of #u4578
and at every instance of confluence symbols are different ;( may be it bound with server encoding

I have a decision how to transfer cyrillic letters to server if it works on Windows with win1251 -
If transformate tellers to win1251 encoding before calling 'escape' function then all became works fine


And I have one more variant how to send data to server :
I wrote following code for sending one row of dynamic table to server (AddRow function) (test page)

<meta http-equiv="Content-Type" content="text/html; charset=utf-8">
<body>
<form name=loginform action='http://test1.employees.compassplus.ru:8080/plugins/dynamictable/addRow.action' method=post>
<input type="text" name="tableName" value="FirstName" style=" width: 90%"/>
<input type="text" name="entityId" value="18" style=" width: 90%"/>
<input type="text" name="cells" value="" style=" width: 90%"/>
<input type="text" name="cells" value="" style=" width: 90%"/>
<input type="text" name="cells" value="" style=" width: 90%"/>
<button type="submit" name="submit" >Submit</button>
</form>
</body>

if you fill forms and send them to server using POST you will have a GOOD result (all symbols will looks OK)
BUT if you will usу GET method for sending (to know how to encode symbols) you will see the same bug as at 5)



Can anybody tell me
1) is confluence use it's system (server) encoding to decode URL ?
2) how can I rewrite plugin or do smth else to allow Dymanic Table Plugin work with cyrillic letters?
fields.summary: URL encoding/decoding problem

fields.description:
As a result of CONF-3307, the recently-updated macro now includes attachments, comments and news. We'd like to see this made into an option, so only page changes can be displayed. In fact, filtering out changes flagged as minor (where no notifications are sent) would be good too.

Ideally, one would be able to choose from the following for the macro to display:-
- major page changes
- minor page changes
- attachments
- comments
- news
fields.summary: Filtering output from recently-updated macro

fields.description: We cull out the page-slice of attachments before we sort them, which doesn't make much sense.
fields.summary: Sort order broken on space attachments page

fields.description: Currently the "Visit page outside Confluence" tooltip for external links is stored in com.atlassian.renderer.util.RendererProperties as a constant string. It would be useful to externalise this to allow for internationalisation and user customisation.
fields.summary: Make the "Visit page outside Confluence" tooltip more user customisable

fields.description: When a page is deleted which has edit/view restrictions, the page is correctly removed from the space, and the index, but remains listed on Space Admin -> Restricted Pages.  When the page link is clicked from this location, the user is taken to a blank screen (no error message, no stack trace, just a blank white page).  When deleting a page with restrictions, the user should either be prompted to remove the restrictions first, or Confluence should remove the restrictions recursively as the page is being deleted so that the page will no be listed under Space Admin -> Restricted Pages after it is removed.
fields.summary: Deleted pages are included on restricted pages list in space admin

fields.description: periodically the edit window (textarea with rich-text / wiki-markup / preview tabs) will shrink to a tiny box (5x5 maybe) with some gibberish inside it.  Save buttons are disabled and most links on the page will not work but viewing pages elsewhere on the site is still fine.  The behavior is consistent across edit news and edit page, is browser independent (IE and firefox same) and I've only found a server restart to cure it.
fields.summary: page & news edit window broken, randomly, after some period of time the server has been running
Support language selection for anonymous users

fields.description:
In my perl script, I retrieve the child pages of a certain page, then for each child page object, I update the title of the child page then call confluence1.storePage to store the page, and the script hangs for a long time, then gives up.  This happens for almost every page in 2.1.5a.  This exact same script was used before on some earlier Confluence versions (I forgot which ones) and was working on 80% of the child pages, but get stuck on some child pages.  I didn't notice anything special about those child pages that storePage failed on and I ignored the problem.  But now in 2.1.5a, the update failed on every single page.

I did some initial testing and found that whether the page has attachment or not do not affect storePage.  I also removed all attributes of the child page object and leaving only title, space, version (either the previous version number or the previous version + 1), id, content, and it didn't help.  The page content itself does not have anything suspicious (some of the pages are actually completely empty).

Please let me know if storePage updating page title is working fine in 2.1.5a.  If it's a version-specific bug then I'll upgrade later.
fields.summary: StorePage hangs when updating page title

fields.description:
Steps to reproduce:

1. Create a page with special characters (e.g., C++ Page) so that editing the page shows the page id instead of the page name
2. Attach an image to that page
3. Export space to HTML (attached images are duplicated, once under [page name]_attachment and once under page id)
4. Rename page so that it does not contain special characters (e.g., CPP Page)
5. Reexport space to HTML (attached images are still duplicated for all pages!, once under [page name]_attachment and once under page id)
fields.summary: HTML Export: Duplicate attached images

fields.description:
I know that perhaps there may never ever be the need for a page title to be longer then 255 characters. However, programmatically speaking, should we at least capture this limitation by a more user friendly message instead of throwing an exception?
Something similar to the error message that is produced when an user uses special characters within page title?
" Page titles cannot contain : @ / \ | ^ # ; [ ] { } or start with .. $ or ~. "

Page title is too long, limit is 255 char.

Thanks,
Ivan

fields.summary: Page title length limited to 255 characters

fields.description:
Description: If an IE user views/edits the page in wiki markup, then switches to the rich text editor to makes changes and returns to wiki markup, those changes from the rich text editor are not displayed until the user until they modify the wiki text, when the textbox updates. The changes are still shown in the preview and saved. 

This is confirmed for Internet Explorer 6.0.29 SP2 and does not affect Firefox 1.5.

To replicate, view a page in IE and edit. View the wiki markup, go to rich text and make changes. Then return to wiki and the changes are not shown until text is modified.
The wiki editor should detect IE and force the textbox to update. One hack might be to add and remove a character automatically.
fields.summary: Content inserted by rich text editor on IE is not shown in wiki markup until user presses a key

fields.description:
When applying formatting such as bold to a link using the rich text editor, the formatting is shown correctly until the users switches to the preview or wiki markup, when the formatting is removed from hyperlinks. 

To replicate, add a link while using the rich text editor and apply the formatting. Note that the formatting is applied to the link. Switch to preview and then wiki markup to see [Bold Link|Home] *Bold Text* instead of *[Bold Link|Home] Bold Text*
fields.summary: Rich text editor strips formatting from links
Detect out of disk space when building index

fields.description: The Attachments tab in Browse Space is only displaying the first 100 attachments (in alpha-numeric order).  If a space contains more than 100 attachments (we have a space with over 1000), only the first 100 are being displayed.  The attachments work correctly, and are being indexed, so this is not a critical bug, but I believe it to be a major bug as it deceptive to a space administrator.  The Attachments tab should display all attachments with pagination beyond four pages.
fields.summary: Attachments Tab in Browse Space only displays first 100 attachments to a space

fields.description:
When moving an entire tree of pages to another space, using the 'with children' checkbox on the page Edit tab, links which use a different case than the corresponding page names which they link to have the old space's name prefixed to them, and are therefore broken (since the pages have been moved to the new space and no longer exist in the old space).

For a while  I wasn't sure which pages had this problem, but now I definitely can say there is a clear and definite pattern: only those links which use a different case than the linked-to page names are affected.
fields.summary: When moving an entire tree of pages to another space, links with different case than linked pages have old space's name prefixed to them

fields.description:
The jiraissues macro allows to embed JIRA issues into Confluence pages - no problem, as long as you access an public instance of JIRA with public issues.

But if UserIDs and Passwords needed to access non-puglic issues in JIRA, they had to be passed in the URL as parameters.

{jiraissues:url=http://jira.rss.url?os_username=johnsmith&os_password=secret}

Details: http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/JIRA+Issues+Macro

But if you obtain a Confluence page with this macro, unfortunately the UserID and Passwords are visible on the Confluence Page as URL link including UserID and Password.

The improvement request:
To add an macro parameter "HIDEURL".

Setting this new parameter would preserve the URL, but would *cut off* the os_username os_password strings!
The Confluence page will just include the URL without the sensitive UserID and Password.

Together with http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONF-6647 it becomes a perfect security solution with reasonable development effort.

Waiting for http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONF-1595 is *not* an option because it looks like a lot of development effort (= takes too long!) compared to this minor improvement request and the minor http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONF-6647 feature request.
fields.summary: add HIDEURL parameter to jiraissues macro to protect jira userids and passwords

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-6647].
  {panel}

Using several confluence macros (jiraissues, SQL, CHAR-Plugin etc.) needs to embedd sensitive information (UserID, Passwords, SQL-Statements, etc.). to the Confluence source pages.

Currently, there is no way to hide this information, because view page permission == view page source permission.

You can edit the layer templates to remove the 'page source' link, but the 'view source URL' will still work for anyone who can see the page.

The only way to hide this sensitive information is to prevent access to the Confluence Page Source.

This leads to the feature request to add a new permission type: "view page source" to be able to revoke access to the page sources.

Without this feature, Confluence pages are limited to non-sensitive information if you provide access for external parties like customers etc.
fields.summary: add permission type VIEW PAGE SOURCE

fields.description:
There is the {blog-posts} macro with the "labels" parameter. That parameter allows to select posts having one or more labels, where the list of labels might either be AND'ed or OR'ed.

What I would like is to list all blog-posts NOT having any one of several labels, or NOT having all of several labels.

I suggest to extend the label selection syntax of the blog-posts macro to also allow for negation of the expression, or parts of the expression.

I also suggest to check, which other commands use a label selection syntax and to amend them accordingly.
fields.summary: Allow negation of label selection in blog-posts (and other?!) commands
Add "Move Page" permission

fields.description: Presently renaming a page will cause update notifications to be sent for all pages which refer to the renamed page. This occurs because of edits performed on the referring pages to reflect the new linked page name. These edits should be regarded as minor edits that do not trigger update emails to users who are watching the referring pages.
fields.summary: Page renaming should only trigger minor edits in referring pages

fields.description: 2006-07-21 00:00:00,598 WARN [atlassian.confluence.mail.ChangeDigestNotificationBean] getContentCreatedOrUpdatedSinceDate ContentEntityObject from unknown subclass: class com.atlassian.confluence.user.PersonalInformation
fields.summary: ChangeDigestNotificationBean doesn't expect changes in PersonalInformation instances

fields.description: The footer on the edit space permissions screen is broken.
fields.summary: Edit Space Permissions footer layout broken

fields.description:
I need the ability to copy a parent page and all child pages and the children of the child pages with attachments.

CosmoCom needs the ability to provide user documentation on different versions of its software simultaneously. The copying feature I request makes it possible to do that efficiently. I would be able to keep the page heirarchy I started with in the previous version and make only the changes I need to support a new version of the software.

Currently, I have to copy one page at a time and link parents and child pages manually. I only started a new project yesterday and already have to repair serious mistakes.
fields.summary: copy parent page with all child pages and attachments
Dialog for selecting attachment for linking should include comment

fields.description:
The location of pages can be changed, in the hierarchy within the same space as well as between spaces.

It would come in handy sometimes to be able to move news/blog posts between spaces, too.  The current workaround is to copy&paste the whole entry, then create a new one in the destination space, paste the source, save it, and delete the old post.

This not only breaks internal and external (tiny) links, it's also cumbersome to use, and destroys history.
fields.summary: Enable moving news/blog posts between spaces

fields.description:
Fix regresssion: 

Search results do not display labels, even if the hit is associated with labels.
fields.summary: Display labels in search results

fields.description:
Found a small bug in the color rendering of the code xml macro - color rendering is reversed after the occurrence of an empty attribute. Have attached a small example to demonstrate.

Bug is in Confluence 2.1.3 running under Tomcat on Windows 2003 Server under JVM 1.5.0_06.

Consider the following XML snippet contained in a \{code:xml} macro:

{noformat}
{code:xml}
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>
<JDBC_MSG>
    <Transaction ID="61">
        <SQL rowcount="2" exception="false">
            <Statement>select * from project p limit 2</Statement>
            <ResultSet>
                <Row>
                    <Column name="ID" value="10073" type="DECIMAL" precision="18" scale="0" displaySize="19" />
                    <Column name="pname" value="m3t4.studio" type="VARCHAR" precision="255" scale="0" displaySize="255" />
                    <Column name="URL" value="" type="VARCHAR" precision="255" scale="0" displaySize="255" />
                    <Column name="LEAD" value="dbigwood" type="VARCHAR" precision="255" scale="0" displaySize="255" />
                    <Column name="DESCRIPTION" value="" type="VARCHAR" precision="65535" scale="0" displaySize="65535" />
                    <Column name="pkey" value="META" type="VARCHAR" precision="255" scale="0" displaySize="255" />
                    <Column name="pcounter" value="0" type="DECIMAL" precision="18" scale="0" displaySize="19" />
                    <Column name="ASSIGNEETYPE" value="2" type="DECIMAL" precision="18" scale="0" displaySize="19" />
                </Row>
            </ResultSet>
        </SQL>
    </Transaction>
</JDBC_MSG>
{code}
{noformat}

Specifically the section in the middle starting:

{code:xml}
<Column name="URL" value="" type="VARCHAR"
{code}

The problem is with the color coding after the empty value attribute quotes. Before the empty quotes strings are green and attribute names blue, after the empty quotes until the end of the current tag, the colors are reversed.

Regards
-David Bigwood 

The problem is in the regex

{code:java}
    public static final String QUOTES = "(\"|\\")(.+?)(?<!(\"|\\"))(\"|\\")";
{code}
fields.summary: Code macro doesn't correctly handle empty strings

fields.description:
We have been running confluence on GlassFish ((V1 UR1 Build 03 30-June-06) without any visible problems for couple days now. We would like to help any efforts to get confluence supported on GlassFish. 

This link is an error message that we have noticed in the GlassFish log file

https://support.atlassian.com/browse/CSP-4604

{panel:title=Atlassian Status as of September 10,  2010|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#3C78B5| titleBGColor=#3C78B5| bgColor=#E7F4FA}
Thanks for your suggestions and feedback on this issue. Over the past few months we have done a lot of analysis on the supportability of enterprise application servers such as GlasshFish. 

As the complexity of our applications grows, the cost of supporting multiple platforms increases exponentially. Each new feature has to be tested on several combinations of application servers, databases, web browsers, etc, with setup and ongoing maintenance of automated tests. Moving forward, we want to reduce the time spent there to increase Confluence development speed significantly. At times, 30% of the development team is busy coding solutions for edge cases in various application servers.

We have chosen to standardise on Tomcat, because it is the most widely used application server in our user population. It is fast, robust, secure, well-documented, easy to operate, open source, and has a huge community driving improvements.

With this in mind and in the spirit of open company, we will be closing this issue as we have made the decision that we will not be doing this.

Sherif Mansour
Confluence Product Management
{panel}
fields.summary: Support for GlassFish
LDAP over TLS

  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-6594].
  {panel}

Enable linking to attachments in different spaces and pages using the "link" icon in Editor toolbar.

Presently, an user can use the Insert/Edit link to link to attachments attached to the current page only.

Please see associated discussion here:

http://forums.atlassian.com/thread.jspa?forumID=96&threadID=12007

"Unfortunately, I'm in a situation where most of our users will simply not refer to the attachment at all rather than learn the notation for adding the attachment in wiki; in other words, if they can't do it in the GUI, they won't do it at all."

"What I'd like is when I do a search, or i go to the Recently modified tab, that attachments also show up, regardless of space or parent. "

fields.description:
If you set the maximum attachment size to something smallish (in my example 200k) and then try to upload a largish plugin (in my example, somewhere over 300k) then the plugin upload dies and reports the following action error message.

The following error(s) occurred:

    * com.atlassian.confluence.util.FileUploadUtils$FileUploadException

I'm not sure which is the error though, whether its the max attachment size affecting plugin uploading (I can see how that would be by design even though its not obvious that it would be the case), or that GeneralUtil.getUploadFileTooLargeMessage isnt substituting the exception into the error message ... take your pick!
fields.summary: Max attachment size affects uploadplugin.action

fields.description:
Please add "overflow: auto" to at least your .preformatted CSS class.  This will create horizontal scrollbars when necessary for just the preformatted boxes.  Otherwise, wide preformatted lines will force the whole page to that width, requiring the user to scroll horizontally to read every line of content of the page (not just the preformatted content).

(I like to minimize my horizontal scrolling.)
fields.summary: css: auto overflow for .preformatted

fields.description:
As I said, I'm not an admin, so I don't have access to the most powerful user management tools.  But I did create a space, and I want to manage user privileges there.  On the Space Admin page, in the Individual Users section, I click the little magnifying glass next to "Users to Add".  This brings up Users Search.  I can't remember any of the specific characteristics (username, name, email) for the person I'm thinking of.  So I put in the name of the appropriate group in "Members of group:".  This gives me a list, but it's a very long list, at least seven pages.  The first page only has the letters A through C.  When I click the link for page 2 or "Next>>", it sends me to Users Search with some of the blanks filled in:  Username is ${usernameTerm}, Full name is ${fullnameTerm}, and Email is {$emailTerm}.  There is no list of users.  This isn't very helpful.

While I have your attention, I would suggest some features.  It would be good if the Users Search tool could search for partial matches.  For instance, if I only know the person's last name or the domain part of the email address.  It would also be nice if the list could be made alphabetical by last name, rather than userid.  I see that some of the full names are not really complete, so it would be good to require people to have both a first name and a last name.  (For instance, user "arinks" has Full name "arin".)
fields.summary: Can only view the first page of Users Search results

[-Test Page-|Test] becomes [|Test]-[-Test Page-|Test]-
